body_html:
I have Anaconda 4.3.1 (64bit) with Python 3.6 and couldn't find a workable version of Tensorflow anywhere. I tried some workarounds and unofficial builds I found here, it just didn't work out for me. Frustrated as I was after struggling for a few days, I decided to build one myself. It turned out the building was very smooth, I didn't hit any issue other than taking a few hours. Here is my build env:

  • tensorflow 1.1.0rc2 with GPU
  • Python 3.6/Anaconda 3.4.1
  • CUDA Tookit 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1
  • Swigwin 3.0.12
  • CMake 3.8.0
  • Windows 10 pro.

The build works just fine for me. I can give it to anyone who asks.

Thanks,

body:
I have Anaconda 4.3.1 (64bit) with Python 3.6 and couldn't find a  workable version of Tensorflow anywhere. I tried some workarounds and unofficial builds I found here, it just didn't work out for me. Frustrated as I was after struggling for a few days, I decided to build one myself. It turned out the building was very smooth, I didn't hit any issue other than taking a few hours. Here is my build env:

- tensorflow 1.1.0rc2 with GPU
- Python 3.6/Anaconda 3.4.1
- CUDA Tookit 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1 
- Swigwin 3.0.12
- CMake 3.8.0
- Windows 10 pro.

The build works just fine for me. I can give it to anyone who asks.

Thanks,
